title: Lettuce Wraps with Smoked Trout
summary: Lettuce Wraps with Smoked Trout might be a good recipe to expand your hor d'oeuvre recipe box. One serving contains 646 calories, 76g of protein, and 28g of fat. This recipe serves 4 and costs $9.54 per serving. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian diet. A mixture of shallots, hothouse cucumber, sugar, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. To use up the sugar you could follow this main course with the Whole Wheat Refined Sugar Free Sugar Cookies as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. It is brought to you by Epicurious. Overall, this recipe earns a tremendous spoonacular score of 89%. Try Lettuce Wraps With Smoked Trout, Smoked Trout Lettuce Wraps with Meyer Lemon Dressing and Carrots, and Chicken Lettuce wraps like P.F. Changs – lettuce wraps are delicious and an unique appetizer that many people enjoy for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Using vegetable peeler, shave carrots andcucumber lengthwise into ribbons. Cutribbons into 3-inch-long sections, then cutsections into matchstick-size strips. Placein large bowl. Add shallots, jalapeños, limejuice, sugar, and fish sauce; let marinate 30minutes at room temperature.                                                                Add trout pieces and tomatoes tovegetable mixture and toss to blend.Transfer trout-vegetable mixture to largestrainer and drain off liquid. Return trout-vegetablemixture to same bowl; add mintand basil and toss to blend.                                                                Arrange lettuce leaves on large platter.Divide trout-vegetable salad among lettuceleaves. Drizzle sweet chili sauce over eachsalad and sprinkle with peanuts.                                                                            * Available in the Asian foods section of most supermarkets, at some specialty foods stores, and at Asian markets.                                                                ** Available at some supermarkets and at specialty foods stores and delicatessens.                                                                ***Available at some supermarkets and at Asian markets and from amazon.com.

steps.step: Using vegetable peeler, shave carrots andcucumber lengthwise into ribbons.
Cutribbons into 3-inch-long sections, then cutsections into matchstick-size strips.
Add shallots, jalapeños, limejuice, sugar, and fish sauce; let marinate 30minutes at room temperature.
Add trout pieces and tomatoes tovegetable mixture and toss to blend.
Transfer trout-vegetable mixture to largestrainer and drain off liquid. Return trout-vegetablemixture to same bowl; add mintand basil and toss to blend.
Arrange lettuce leaves on large platter.Divide trout-vegetable salad among lettuceleaves.
Drizzle sweet chili sauce over eachsalad and sprinkle with peanuts.
* Available in the Asian foods section of most supermarkets, at some specialty foods stores, and at Asian markets.
** Available at some supermarkets and at specialty foods stores and delicatessens.
***Available at some supermarkets and at Asian markets and from amazon.com.
